author: Ryan Morgan
description: Russian leaders have repeatedly challenged Zelenskyy's legitimacy, as Ukraine's wartime laws prevent regular elections.
title: Trump Dismisses Russia’s Questioning of Zelenskyy’s Legitimacy as ‘Posturing’

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Icelandic Air Policing, Rohingya Refugees Camp, and Drying Raisins

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec Premier François Legault has been called to testify at the public inquiry into the cost overrun scandal at the province’s auto insurance board. Representatives of the Gallant Commission say the premier will appear next Tuesday. The commission is examining how the creation of the online platform known as SAAQclic incurred cost overruns of at […]
title: Quebec Premier to Testify at Inquiry Into $500M Cost Overrun Scandal at Auto Board

author: The Canadian Press
description: Bank of Canada governor Tiff Macklem says flexibility is key as the bank prepares to review its rate-setting framework in a world undergoing an economic sea change. Macklem on Tuesday discussed the central bank’s upcoming mandate review in remarks prepared for a speech in Mexico City today as the Banco de México celebrates its 100th […]
title: Bank of Canada Aims for Flexibility in Rate-Setting Framework Review, Says Macklem

author: Noé Chartier
description: Ottawa and Brasilia have announced that trade negotiations for Canada to join the South American trading bloc Mercosur will resume shortly, amid both capitals seeking to diversify away from the United States. The announcement about the resumption of trade talks was made in a joint Brazil-Canada statement issued by the Brazilian Ministry of Foreign Relations […]
title: Canada and South American Bloc Mercosur to Resume Trade Talks

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The federal government has reduced the pool of candidates for constructing the navy’s new submarines to a German company and a South Korean firm, as part of its plan to bolster Canada’s defence capabilities in the Arctic. German company Thyssen Krupp Marine Systems and Hanwha Ocean Co. in South Korea were identified in an Aug. […]
title: German, Korean Companies Identified as Qualified Suppliers to Build Canada’s New Submarines

author: Ryan Morgan
description: Several journalists and first responders had arrived at the scene of the damaged Gaza hospital section when Israeli forces conducted a second strike.
title: Israeli Military Says Deadly Strikes on Gaza Hospital Targeted Suspected Hamas Camera

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says the federal government is set to announce investments in Canadian ports that could be used to ship Liquid Natural Gas (LNG) to other countries, including investments in Manitoba’s Port of Churchill. “Our government is in the process of unleashing half a trillion dollars of investment in energy infrastructure, port infrastructure […]
title: Carney Says First Major Projects to Include Port Infrastructure, Touts LNG Potential

author: Jack Phillips
description: 'We just stopped a shipment that was contaminated' with a radioactive substance, the U.S. Health secretary said.
title: FDA Ramps Up Inspections of Shrimp Amid Radioactive Contamination Reports, RFK Jr. Confirms

author: Chandra Philip
description: U.S health official and former television personality Dr. Mehmet Oz says culling a herd of ostriches at a B.C. farm would be a mistake because the animals offer an “incredible opportunity” for scientific research. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) ordered nearly 400 birds at Universal Ostrich Farms in Edgewood, B.C., to be culled after […]
title: Dr. Oz Says BC Ostriches May Hold ‘Secrets’ of Avian Flu Immunity

author: Barry W. Bussey
description: Commentary In recent months, Canadian lawmakers and policymakers have openly questioned fundamental assumptions about the role of religion in our society, particularly regarding its recognition as a charitable purpose. The House of Commons finance committee’s proposal to eliminate or restrict religious charities from receiving tax benefits and official recognition as serving the public good is […]
title: Why the Advancement of Religion as a Charitable Purpose Must Be Preserved in Canada

author: Conrad Black
description: Commentary Waving the maple leaf flag around with a lot of Demosthenean hyperbole about defending Canada from imminent American aggression—all electoral campaigning a sophisticated electorate would have seen through—Mark Carney won on a platform that is still officially committed to escalation of Justin Trudeau’s outright declaration of war on the petroleum industry. The result is […]
title: Conrad Black: To Hold Canada Together, Ottawa Needs a Daring Strategy

author: Frank Fang
description: The Japanese national holds a communist China flag and says Taiwan is part of China in the video.
title: Taiwan Deports Japanese Man After Filming Pro-China Video in Taipei

author: The Canadian Press
description: A group of Hudson’s Bay landlords say a lender’s desire to recoup cash is the only reason the shuttered department store is pursuing a plan to sell its leases to a B.C. billionaire. In new court documents filed late Monday, the landlords say the retailer is keen to make a sale of 25 leases to […]
title: Hudson’s Bay Wants to Sell Leases to Billionaire to Appease Lender: Landlords

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Montreal college has resumed classes even as it faces a $30-million fine by the Quebec government for exceeding enrolment in English-language programs. LaSalle College had postponed the return to class on Monday because of the impasse with the provincial government. In its 2022 language law the Quebec government imposed limits on the number of […]
title: Montreal’s LaSalle College Classes Resume, Impasse Endures With Quebec Over $30M Fine

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The commission responsible for evaluating judicial compensation says an annual salary of $414,900 is insufficient to attract high-calibre candidates and recommends Ottawa raise judges’ salaries by at least $28,000 annually. The report from the Judicial Compensation and Benefits Commission recommends an increase in judges’ salaries by $28,000 for regular provincial superior and appellate courts, and […]
title: Panel Recommends $28K-$36K Pay Raise for Federal Judges

author: Noé Chartier
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney has continued his trade diversification efforts during a visit to Germany, pledging to cooperate on critical minerals with Europe’s largest economy and opening the door to exporting liquified natural gas (LNG). Carney made the stop in Germany on Aug. 26, after visits earlier this week in Ukraine and Poland. During the […]
title: Carney Seeks Critical Minerals Cooperation With Germany, Opens Door to LNG Exports

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new study says Canada’s tech job market has gone from boom to bust in a matter of years. The research from job postings site Indeed says August openings in the sector posted on its platform were down 19 percent from their early 2020 levels. Indeed says the fall was likely caused by either the […]
title: Canada’s Tech Job Market Has Gone From Boom to Bust in Last Five Years: Indeed

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ontario is in the midst of a “generational housing crisis” that has brought new home construction to a “standstill” even as the population continues to grow, the province’s housing minister says. Housing Minister Rob Flack presented a grim overview of the sector during a press conference this week that saw Premier Doug Ford hand $12 […]
title: Home Building in Ontario at a ‘Standstill,’ Housing Minister Says

author: Adam Morrow
description: Robust security guarantees for post-conflict Ukraine are the best way to ensure lasting peace, the German vice chancellor told reporters in Kyiv.
title: Berlin Doubles Down on Support for Kyiv, Reiterates Call for Security Guarantees

author: Epoch Video
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz hosts Canadian Premier Mark Carney at the chancellery in Berlin, followed by a joint news conference, on Aug. 26.
title: Germany’s Chancellor and Canada’s Premier Hold Joint News Conference

author: The Canadian Press
description: Gregor Robertson, the minister responsible for the federal agency that helped fund a BC Ferries contract to buy ships from China, says Canada needs to “catch up” with the United States when it comes to protecting domestic jobs and the economy by buying more domestic goods. Robertson told a news conference Monday that Ottawa is […]
title: Asked About Chinese Ferry Deal, Gregor Robertson Says ‘Buy Canada’ Policy Needs Work

author: Chris Summers
description: France, Germany, and the UK have said that unless Iran makes concessions by Aug. 31, they will begin initiating the process to reimpose U.N. sanctions.
title: Fresh Talks Begin With Iran as European Powers Threaten Snapback Sanctions

author: Guy Birchall
description: François Bayrou has put his premiership on the line in a vote due to be held in the National Assembly in Paris on Sept 8.
title: French Prime Minister Calls September Confidence Vote

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: AP and Reuters demand answers as Israel calls the incident a 'tragic mishap' and orders an investigation.
title: Israeli Strikes Gaza Hospital, Killing Several Journalists

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Support emerged for tariff cuts and EV charging, but AI focus, construction code pause, and immigration neglect drew strong criticism.
title: Experts Endorse EV Road Charge, Throws Doubt on Other Productivity Roundtable Outcomes

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Opposition and premiers endorse decisive steps against Iran, but Jewish, Iranian diaspora groups, Greens say action was overdue.
title: Parliament, Community United on Expelling Iranian Ambassador After Tehran Linked to Anti-Semitic Attacks

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Supermarket inflation for the year was 1.5 percent, while Coles reported a net profit of $1.08 billion.
title: Supermarket Giant Coles Reports $44 Billion Sales Revenue

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The incident occurred in Victoria's northeast.
title: 1 Officer Wounded, 2 Feared Dead in Victoria Shooting Incident: Police Association

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Fortescue highlighted its continued interest in the China market.
title: Fortescue Profits Plunge 41 Percent on Weak China Demand, Push for ‘Green Iron’ Continues

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A report by a prominent think tank is calling for AUKUS nations to increase long-range capabilities and lethality.
title: Former US Defense Advisor Urges Leaders to Narrow AUKUS Focus

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: ASIO confirms Tehran directed synagogue and restaurant firebombings.
title: Australia Expels Iranian Ambassador Over Alleged Role in Anti-Semitic Arson Attacks

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The president said digital taxes are designed ‘to harm, or discriminate against, American Technology.’
title: Trump Threatens New Tariffs, Chip Export Curbs on Countries With Digital Taxes

author: The Associated Press
description: MIAMI—Tropical Storm Juliette formed Monday in the Pacific Ocean hundreds of miles from Mexico’s Baja California peninsula as Tropical Storm Fernand churned in the Atlantic Ocean. No coastal watches or warnings were in effect for either storm, the Miami-based U.S. National Hurricane Center said. Juliette posed no immediate threat to land, forecasters said. The storm […]
title: Tropical Storm Juliette Forms in the Pacific as Fernand Churns Over Open Waters in the Atlantic

author: The Associated Press
description: MELBOURNE, Australia—The sole survivor of a deadly lunch laced with toxic mushrooms said Monday he felt only half alive following the death of his wife and he continued to grieve the loss of his two closest friends. Ian Wilkinson read the first victim impact statement at a sentencing hearing for Erin Patterson at the Victoria […]
title: Sole Survivor of Australian Mushroom Poisoning Grieves Loss of Wife and Friends

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Latest figures show emissions trending down across energy and industry, but transport pollution continues to rise.
title: Deloitte Builds Economic Case for 75 Percent Emissions Cut

author: Rudy Blalock
description: Representatives from India and South Korea gathered Saturday to commemorate the third annual joint Independence Day celebration, highlighting the shared Aug. 15 independence date that bonds the two nations. The event took place at the Indian Consulate, hosted by Consul General Binaya Pradhan in partnership with the Shanti Fund and the MultiCultural Council of New […]
title: India, South Korea Mark 3rd Joint Independence Day Celebration in New York

author: John Robson
description: Commentary From sea to shining C-minus, the authorities do not trust Canadians, and we trust them not to. Nova Scotia banned walking in the woods lest we dunces set the place ablaze with incandescent hiking boots, while Vancouver banned teaching your own kid to swim in city pools. Welcome to government of the expert, by […]
title: John Robson: How ‘Rule of the Expert’ Is Displacing Genuine Self-Government in Canada

author: Eva Fu
description: 'Intimidation of or threats against the civil society are not acceptable,' Finnish Ministry for Foreign Affairs told The Epoch Times.
title: Finland Condemns Former Hong Kong Chief’s Threat Against Falun Gong, Calling It ‘Unacceptable’

author: Cindy Li
description: 'If you look around the Middle East, it is the monarchies which have enjoyed a considerable degree of success,' said former Australian PM Tony Abbott.
title: A Symbol Above Politics, Monarchy Taps Into Human Need for Identity and Ritual: Tony Abbott

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre has called the latest data released by the federal immigration department “disastrous,” as he says the numbers indicate Canada will surpass some of its 2025 immigration targets. “A Canada First immigration and refugee system should only invite the right people in the right numbers so our jobs, healthcare and housing can […]
title: Conservatives Press on Immigration as Latest Data Released

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Australia's national postal service has implemented the change in a bid to rejig its internal systems to cope with tariff changes.
title: Australia Post Temporarily Suspends Some Parcel Delivery Services to the US, Puerto Rico

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: New Brunswick says people will once again be permitted to enter the woods and fish, camp, and hike, starting at midnight Monday night, although a provincial fire ban will remain in place. On Aug. 10, the provincial government restricted access to public forested areas, closing many campgrounds and banning hiking, fishing, or driving in the […]
title: New Brunswick to Roll Back Most Wildfire Restrictions, Allow Access to Woods

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: States loyal to, and dependent on, CCP money are kowtowing to Beijing while others struggle to maintain the Forum's cohesiveness.
title: Beijing’s Wedge Politics Threatens Pacific Islands Forum Unity Over Taiwan

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Canada-U.S. Trade Minister Dominic LeBlanc is set to visit Washington on Aug. 26, after Ottawa lifted some retaliatory tariffs on the United States. LeBlanc will meet with U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and said he hopes to strike a trade deal with the United States that is favourable for Canadians. On Aug. 22, Prime Minister […]
title: Minister LeBlanc to Visit Washington After Canada Drops Some Counter-Tariffs on US

author: Eva Fu
description: Officials from China's top espionage agency asked him to collect intelligence on U.S. citizens associated with Falun Gong.
title: Taiwan Sentences Ex-Military Officer for Spying on Falun Gong

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney met with Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk in Warsaw on Aug. 25 to discuss developing stronger ties between the two countries, including enhanced cooperation on energy, defence, and trade. The two leaders annoucned a renewed long-term partnership that would “guide and deepen bilateral cooperation in the years ahead,” according to the […]
title: In Warsaw, Carney Announces Expanded Defence and Trade Partnership With Poland

author: Josh Spasaro
description: A councillor at Moorabool Shire Council says the Victorian government is concerned about the strong response to the levy.
title: Farmers Urged to Be Vigilant After Victorian Labor Pauses New Tax on Landowners
